intro: Blennosperma nanum, commonly known as the dwarf blennosperma, is a small shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 30 centimeters and has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, making it a valuable source of nectar for pollinators. Due to its hardy nature, it is well adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments.
